data.title: Pretty Cool historic Home in Pompano Beach
data.text: Nice to look back on the past years and history where you live, work and reside. I recommend it and a tour if you like history and architecture.

data.title: Site is Cool
data.text: Enjoy the space, history, and gardens. However, the staff can use some training on service and manners. Otherwise, have great events, and consider a 'cool', chill, and relax space.

data.title: South Florida History ob view
data.text:
In most of the world, a one-hundred-year-old house would attract little attention, but in South Florida, a century harks back to the beginning of settler history. Built in 1916, the house was originally located on Dixie Highway, in the midst of Albert Sample's pineapple fields. It was moved to the current location in 2001.  It is not fancy but it is sound: that is historically accurate

Guided tours on Tuesdays and Thursdays afternoons at 1, 2 and 3 pm. Saturdays hourly from 11 to 3.  Admission $5.00.

data.title: Pompano Beach Historical House
data.text: A replica of a the home of Sample-McDougald, a founder of Pompano Beach.  The house is open as a museum for visits.

data.title: Beautiful Historical Home
data.text: We went to see the art exhibit from the Florida Highwaymen (we bought a beautiful oil painting) and we were able to tour the entire home and estate.  It is beautifully restored.  Lovely woodwork.  I had met a man at the local dog park who told me great stories of when he was a child spending Christmases in the house.  (He was a decedent).  I've wanted to tour it since hearing his stories.  It was nice to envision a huge happy family celebrating in this home.
